column4: How do I make it to where I don't have to type export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/lib anymore when I reboot the computer?
I have a certain program I have to type "export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/lib" before I run it, how do I make it to where I don't have to do this anymore?
to set this env variable, you can have a script with "env LD..; actual_command" and that's it
nope, name isn't relevant, but execute permission is
